pages.text: What is the matter with you, why do you not help each other (now)
No! But on that Day they shall submit themselves, (to the Judgment)
And they will turn to one another, and question one another
They will say: "It was you who used to come to us from the right hand (of power and authority)
They will reply: "No, you, yourselves were not believers
Also we did not have any authority over you. No, it was you who were a transgressing people
So now (this moment) has come true against us, the Word of our Lord that we shall really taste (the penalty of our sins)
We led you astray: Because, truly we were ourselves astray
Then truly, (on) that Day, they will (all) share in the Penalty
Surely, that is how We shall deal with the criminals (Al-Mujrimun)
Truly, when they were told that there is no god except Allah, they would fill themselves up with (false) pride
And they said: "What! Shall we give up our gods for the sake of a poet possessed?" (Referring to Prophet)
No, he (the Messenger) has come with the Truth, and he restates (the Message of) the messengers (before him)
Verily, you shall really taste the painful Penalty—
But it will be no more than the penalty for (the evil) that you have done —
Except the true (and loving) servants of Allah—
For them, their food (and provision) is known
Fruits (and Joys); And they (shall have) honor and dignity
In Gardens of (supreme) happiness
Facing each other on thrones (of dignity)
Around to them will be passed a Cup from a clear-flowing fountain
Crystal-white (and) of a delicious taste for those who drink (from it)
Free from all pains (and annoyances); They will not suffer intoxication (from it)
And beside them will be noble (and pure) women, holding back their looks, with big eyes (filled wonder and beauty)
As if they were (delicate) eggs closely guarded (from evil)
Then they will turn to one another and question one another
One of them will start the speak and say: "Verily, I had a close companion (on the earth)
